result.execSummary:
The defendant Roberto D Garcia Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Roberto D Garcia Jr was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Roberto D Garcia Jr is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Roberto D Garcia Jr was found guilty of Felon Possess Firearm [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Roberto D Garcia Jr was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Eligible for CIP and SAP after serving 2 years of incarceration.

AMENDED 02-15-2018: DEFENDANT IS ELIGIBLE FOR CIP AND SAP AFTER SERVING 1 YEAR OF INCARCERATION

superMiscConds.notes: If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.

Provide DNA sample as required by law and pay assessed surcharge.  Pay costs of supervision and court obligations.  Comply with all rules and regulations of the Department of Corrections.  Cooperate with counseling, treatment and programs determined appropriate.  Follow through with recommendations.  Comply with Family Court and child support orders.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.  Firearm prohibition warning given.

Court Reporter:  Ellen Walfoort. Defendant Roberto D Garcia in court, in custody.  Dirk Christian Jensen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant requests sentence concurrent with two other sentences,  and that eligibility for CIP be reduced, and credit for time served.  
State objects, DOC to determine any credit time.

BTC:  Court could not take into account cases that were pending in front of Judge Mueller at the time of sentencing on this case.  No error or new factor at this time to modify sentence, however, Judgment is modified to defendant will be eligible for CIP and SAT in 1 year after sentencing.   JOC to be modified.   Remainder of defendant's motion is denied.  No due process violations.

Defendant Roberto D Garcia in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Mr. Hamad sent a letter to the Court indicating that there was a discrepancy in the PSI regarding potential charges in Mississippi. The State objects indicating that the agent gave Mr. Hamad very specific information as to how she came up with that information. Defense indicates that the State is correct regarding the contact information but he has not contacted the Sheriff there as the defendant indicates that he doesn't have charges there. The State indicates that the deft has enough of a criminal record that the potential charges in Mississippi won't change anything. The Court will redact the information. The State indicates she understands the request for adj but she does not believe it is severe enough to adjourn the matter again. BTC: Matter to adj is denied.
The Court and the parties have reviewed the redacted PSI. No additions or corrections noted by parties.

BTC: Ct 1 - Total sentence is 7 yrs WPS bifurcated as 3 yrs IC, 4 yrs ES/CFTS
         Ct 2 - 6 mos RCJ, consec to Ct 1, costs
         Ct 3 -6 mos RCJ, consec to Cts 1 & 2, costs
         Ct 4 -6 mos RCJ, consec to Cts 1-3, costs

Conditions:
obey all rules and regs
costs
DNA sample if not already provided & costs
no alc/cs except by Rx
any counseling deemed approp by agent

compliant with any family court or child support orders

Defendant Roberto D Garcia in court with attorney Helmi Hamad and attorney Erin Larsen.  Defendant Roberto D Garcia in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
DAY TWO:

Opening statements.
State calls R.M., DSAT.
State calls Sgt. T. Jones, DSAT.
Ex. 1 offered.  BTC:  Rec'd.
State calls Officer A. Henry, DSAT.
State reads stipulation into record.
Ex 2 offered.  BTC:  Rec'd.
State rests.
Defense moves to dismiss.
BTC:  Motion denied.
Court conducts colloquy with defendant re: right to testify.
BTC:  Finding that defendant freely, voluntarily and knowingly will testify.
Defense calls A.G., DSAT.
Defense calls Roberto Garcia Jr, DSAT.
Defense rests.
State recalls Sgt. T. Jones, still under oath.
State rests.
Defense renews motion to dismiss.
BTC:  Motion denied.
Jury Instruction conference.
Closing arguments.
Instructions read to the jury.
Alternate juror chosen and excused.
Oath #3 given.
Jurors to deliberate 2:31.
Jurors return with verdict 3:44.

VERDICT:
Ct. 1, Felon Possess FA - GUILTY.
Ct. 2, CCW - GUILTY.
Ct. 3, BJ Misd - GUILTY.
Ct. 4, BJ Misd - GUILTY.

Jurors polled and excused.
State moves for judgment on verdict.
Defense moves for judgment notwithstanding verdict.
BTC:  Judgment on verdict granted.  PSI ordered.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 21, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Roberto D Garcia in court with attorney Helmi Hamad and Erin Larsen.  Defendant Roberto D Garcia in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Ms. Riek places her reasoning for amending MIL on the record. Motion of the State regarding heresay matters is sustained and may not be used. The Court will reserve ruling on impeachment.
State calls Sgt. Terrance Jones - DSAT. Direct by the State. Cross by defense. Parties give argument. BTC: Statements may be used in the State's case in chief and will be allowed. The State's last offer is put on the record. The defendant has rejected the State's offer and wishes to go to trial. Jury enters courtroom, Oath #1 given. Ms. Riek introduces self/other attorneys in her office. Mr. Hamad introduces self, Ms. Larsen and the defendant as well as the other attorneys in his office. Voir dire by the Court. Voir dire by Ms. Riek for the State. Voir dire by Mr. Hamad for the defense. Parties exercise their peremptory challenges. The jury is chosen. No objections to the jury as chosen by either party. Defense stipulates that the defendant was on bond at the time of this offense. BTC: The State is to prepare said stipulation.
For Inmate Randall Majors to come from Dodge Correctional Institution to court on 1-6-16 at 8:30 AM.

Defendant Roberto D Garcia in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Roberto D Garcia in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense is giving ADA Riek a copy of the affidavit previously provided to the former prosecutor. Parties MIL reviewed and granted. No 904.04 issues by the State. The Court will give preliminary instructions. Sgt. Jones is requested to be a representative of the State, which is granted. Parties witnesses are all available.  The trial is expected to last less than a day. The State asks for an alternate. 1 alternate, 5 strikes.

Defense has filed a bond motion and asks for contact with victim to be allowed for 15CF996 and 15CF1476. Defense asks for a condition of no violent contact. The State objects as victim is a trial witness.

BTC: JT remains. Bond modification as requested is denied.
from ADA Riek re: Proposed Jury Instructions addendum--attached.

Defendant Roberto D Garcia in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Roberto D Garcia in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The State indicates that there was a misunderstanding between the State and Mr. Hamad. The State does not have its officer here regarding the evidentiary motion. The State indicates that the motion to amended information can go forward. The Miranda/Goodchild motion wil be heard on January 5 prior to voir dire. Defense indicates that they did review motion to amend information and they do not object

BTC: The State may file an amended information. Miranda/Goodchild matter to be decided prior to voir dire. The Court enters pleas of NG on behalf of the defendant to the amended information.

Defendant Roberto D Garcia in court with attorney Carolyn Hillery Delery.  Defendant Roberto D Garcia in custody.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for Sharon Riek for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The poster in 15CF90 & 15CF996, Ms. A Garcia wishes to be removed as poster of cash. Ms. Delery has not seen that letter. Mr. Hamad has filed a motion reducing the bond to $1,500.00 cash. Ms. A. Garcia is in court and the Court conducts a colloquy. Ms. A. Garcia withdraws her request. Defense indicates that Ms. Garcia is asking that no contact be amended to no violent contact. Defense indicates that deft needs an MRI on his knee. Defense indicates that doctor also wants a CAT scan on his stomach. Deft's Aunt will be his caregiver if modification of bond is granted. The State objects to the bond modifications as requested by defense - argument put on the record.

BTC: The Court takes no action on the letter from the poster on 15CF90 & 15CF996. In 15CF1476, the request for no violent contact is denied. In 15CF1476, bond modification is granted. Reduce bond to $2,500.00 cash.
